oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Women's Congress To Meet Next Year By H: K. REYNOLDS WASHINGTON, Jan. 1.—With the avowed purpose of ending the "suhjec- tion of women the world over, to demand equality with men in political and all other activities," an International Parliament of Women will be convened in Washington next vear, it was announced at the headquarters of the National Women's party here. "After clamoring for the vote we are doing nothing with it. ' declared Mrs. O. H. P. Belmont, president of the National Women's party. "We need now to come out in the open in asking for equal rights." A parliament of women from all the countries of the world, Mrs. Belmont declared, will give women a tremendous influence in domestic and foreign affairs,
